dtametasa 0.1.0
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Plot summary ROC curves

Source: R/sroc.R
sROC.matrix.Rd

Plot multiple ROC curves

sROC.matrix(
  par,
  add = FALSE,
  ncols = NULL,
  sroc.lty = 1,
  sroc.lwd = 1,
  add.spoint = TRUE,
  legend = FALSE,
  p.vec,
  legend.text = paste0("p = ", p.vec),
  legend.cex = 1,
  spoint.pch = 18,
  spoint.cex = 2,
  xlab = "1 - specificity",
  ylab = "Sensitivity",
  ...
)

Arguments

par

It can be a vector of (u1 u2 t22 t12), or a matrix with 4 rows. Each column is the vector c(u1, u2, t22, t12).
add

Whether to add the plot into an existed plot. Default is FALSE, to create a new plot.
ncols

Set a vector of different colors for multiple sROC. Defult is NULL, that uses different grey's colors.
sroc.lty

The line tyoe of sROC. Default is solid lines.
sroc.lwd

The line width of sROC. Default is 1.
add.spoint

Whether to add the summary point in the sROC plot. Default it not the add.
legend

Whether to add legend into the plot. Default is not to add.
p.vec

If add the legend (legend = TRUE), define the probability sequence.
legend.text

If add the legend (legend = TRUE), define the legend context.
legend.cex

The font size of legend.
spoint.pch

The point type of the summary point in sROC.
spoint.cex

The point size of the summary point in sROC.
xlab

The label of x-axis. Default is: 1-specificity.
ylab

The label of y-axis. Default is Sensitivity.
...

Other augments in function points or function curve

Value

sROC plot

See also

points, curve, dtametasa.fc, dtametasa.rc.

Examples


# Use matrix

par.matrix <-cbind(c(1, 1.5, 0.5, -0.2),
                   c(1, 1, 1, -0.6),
                   c(1.8, 2, 1,-0.6))

sROC.matrix(par.matrix, legend = TRUE, p.vec = seq(0.2,0.6,0.2), legend.cex = 0.9)


sROC.matrix(par.matrix, legend = TRUE,
      legend.text = c("l1", "l2", "l3"),
      legend.cex = 0.9, ncols = 1:3)


# Use vector

par.vec <- c(1,1.5,0.5,-0.2)

sROC.matrix(par.vec)
